image.altText: A dark haired woman and young girl sit on a couch with their arms around each other smiling.

props.synopsis: Canberran Femke Matthews was shocked to learn it would take a three-hour drive to access the medical care needed to treat her daughter Ashley, who was diagnosed with leukemia at seven.

title.children: Canberra doctors referring patients interstate 'every single day'

image.altText: Canberra hospital building.

props.synopsis: Senior cardiologist Muayad Alasady, who was suspended in 2022 following several inquiries into allegations of bullying and misconduct within the Canberra Hospital, reaches an out-of-court settlement with Canberra Health Services.

title.children: Canberra cardiologist suspended over bullying allegations allowed to return to work

image.altText: A man holding a folder of papers walks next to a man with his head down, outside a building.

props.synopsis: Simon Arthur was overseas when police raided his house, before cutting his trip short and handing himself in when he returned to Australia.

title.children: Police allegedly find half-a-million dollars in cash, drug trafficking instructions at Canberra man's home

image.altText: A woman with an open mouth is about to take a bite from a muffin with piped cream and lemon on top

props.synopsis: A CSIRO survey of almost 2,000 Australians saw 55 per cent of participants report eating more when feeling depressed, and 46 per cent report eating less when feeling happy.

title.children: Females and males report eating different foods for comfort, new study shows

image.altText: An aerial view of houses in Canberra.

props.synopsis: The latest CoreLogic home value data suggests the cost of buying a home in Canberra is stabilising, but there are significant differences between the cost of a house and a unit in the capital.

title.children: Cost of buying a Canberra home is stabilising, new data suggests

image.altText: Woman with fair hair and man with grey hair stand together in formal clothes.

props.synopsis: Senator Linda Reynolds's lawyer tries to eviscerate Brittany Higgins's defamation defence by painting her as a deliberate liar who tried to ruin her former boss's career and bring down the Morrison government.

title.children: Linda Reynolds's lawyer attacks 'arrogant' Brittany Higgins for trivialising senator's hurt from the 'sanctity of France'

image.altText: Firefighters battling urban bushfire

props.synopsis: As chaotic weather wreaks havoc across Tasmania and Victoria, there are warnings over a heightened threat of bushfires in the coming months in other parts of the country.

title.children: Warnings over increased bushfire risk as Australia records warmest August on record

image.altText: A young woman with long dark hair looks into camera with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's leading hospitality groups, Merivale, has been accused of fostering a culture that places women at risk, condones drug use by staff and patrons and fails to adequately address claims of sexual assault.

title.children: Jess lost her friends at Ivy nightclub. Next, she says she was mistaken for a sex worker

image.altText: Empty retail strip in Sydney CBD, artistic shot from low down along pavement.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market is trading lower after the release of GDP figures for the June quarter. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the live markets blog.

title.children: Australia records weakest annual growth in years, ASX falls

image.altText: Regis McPhillamy signage

props.synopsis: The opposition asks Environment Minister Tanya Plibersek to reveal her reasons for granting an Aboriginal protection order over a site earmarked for a tailings dam at the McPhillamys Gold Mine development near Blayney in NSW.

title.children: Coalition challenges Plibersek to explain decision stalling development of $1 billion gold mine

image.altText: The words ‘No Change To WA GST’ have been scrawled on a reporter's arm and signed by Anthony Albanese.

props.synopsis: The GST deal has been described as "the worst public policy decision in Australia so far this century" but none of the major parties will touch it for fear of upsetting Western Australia.

title.children: The major parties are stuck in a $53b GST trap — because no-one dares anger the Vengeful Deity of the West

image.altText: A road can be see through the windscreen of a military vehicle

props.synopsis: For the first time in more than five years and since the Ukraine war began, the ABC crosses into Russia to see what life is like in the occupied city of Sudzha.

title.children: After Ukraine's incursion into Russia, we get a glimpse of life behind Vladimir Putin's iron curtain

image.altText: A woman with a blonde bob against a black background

props.synopsis: Susan Lloyd-Hurwitz, chair of the National Housing Supply and Affordability Council, lists the key areas needing immediate attention and says more scrutiny on landlords "could be useful".

title.children: Head of Australia's housing supply council says rental, housing crises 'profoundly harmful' — as it happened

image.altText: A woman in black suit walking out of court.

props.synopsis: Linda Sun, a former aide to New York Governor Kathy Hochulis, is charged with acting as an agent of the Chinese government in exchange for millions of dollars in compensation and gifts.

title.children: Ex-aide of New York governor charged over secretly acting as Chinese agent

image.altText: A family stand on a suburban street next to a bus stop pole.

props.synopsis: Advocates and refugee legal services say there's currently only one option for Palestinians who arrived in Australia on visitor visas since October: to embark on the often years-long process of seeking permanent asylum.

title.children: Darwish never planned on coming to Australia, but he has no choice but to apply to stay here permanently

image.altText: A middle-aged man in a suit speaks to the media outside a building.

props.synopsis: The Opposition leader said nobody told him about the federal executive's motion to install an administrative committee to oversee operations in NSW, in the wake of the council nominations fiasco.

title.children: Speakman vows to fight on despite being left in the dark over federal takeover

image.altText: An older man with long, grey beard in a dressing gown sits in an armchair

props.synopsis: TasNetworks is scrambling to restore power to more than 11,000 customers, including people like Helmut Bauerle, who has been without power since Saturday.

title.children: Six days after severe weather hit Tasmania, some residents are still unable to cook or heat their homes

image.altText: Adam Bandt press club

props.synopsis: When the Greens proposed an extra super-profits tax on the excessive part of really excessive profits last week, business and the government acted as if the sky was about to fall in. But the principle behind the idea is a good one — as Labor and the Business Council should know better than anyone.

title.children: While the super-tax proposal is being criticised, it's an idea that Labor and big business used to like

image.altText: Mad on left holds cupcakes while sitting next to another man and woman

props.synopsis: The post on the embassy's official Instagram account celebrated "Wear it Purple Day" and expressed dedication to creating "a supporting environment where everyone, especially LGBTQIA+ youth, can feel proud to be themselves".

title.children: Iran summons Australia's ambassador in Tehran over pro-LGBT Instagram post

image.altText: A nurse extracts a vaccine from a small vial into a syringe.

props.synopsis: Two new COVID-19 vaccines targeting the JN.1 variant are under review by the TGA. We asked experts about the new vaccines and what we can expect if they're approved.

title.children: New COVID vaccines could soon be available. So when's the best time to get a booster?

image.altText: Three men wearing suits stand side by side, holding hands in the middle

props.synopsis: Britain has announced it will immediately suspend 30 of its 350 arms export licences with Israel because of a "clear risk" that such equipment might be used to commit serious violations of international humanitarian law.

title.children: Netanyahu calls UK decision to suspend some arms for Israel 'shameful'. Here's what we know about the suspensions

image.altText: Yahya Sinwar, with grey hair and beard, has a serious expression.

props.synopsis: The US Department of Justice announces criminal charges against Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar and other senior militants in the first formal action taken by American law enforcement over the October 7 terrorist attack.

title.children: US Justice Department announces criminal charges against Hamas militants

image.altText: A large red flower with dozens of stems reaching up into a crimson circle sits surrounded by green leaves

props.synopsis: A relative of the famous NSW waratah is now under threat as the federal government says it is using the "best available science" to protect threatened species from extinction.

title.children: Waratah species under threat as danger to flora and fauna grows

image.altText: A close-up image of hands holding a mobile phone

props.synopsis: Researchers also found no association between radio waves from mobile phone towers, or workplace radio wave exposure, and any type of cancer.

title.children: 'No association' between mobile phone use and brain cancers, WHO research says

image.altText: Drone photo of house with border marking the boundary

props.synopsis: Thousands of Aussies are ditching real estate agents to maximise profits when they sell, but there are things you should know before you sell privately.

title.children: Nic saved $11k by selling his home privately. He is one of thousands of Aussies doing the same

image.altText: A man in a paddock with a phone to his ear

props.synopsis: Regional residents are concerned the existing 4G network may put people in danger and won't be reliable once 3G is shutdown.

title.children: As the 3G shutdown looms, anxiety is growing over regional phone coverage

image.altText: a person pins a red awareness ribbon to their white shirt

props.synopsis: New numbers show HIV diagnoses have reduced by a third over the past decade despite a 2023 increase.

title.children: Australia ready for 'the end of AIDS' as HIV diagnoses continue to decrease

image.altText: Palm trees throughout a valley of stepped rice paddies

props.synopsis: Bali boasts world-famous beach clubs, surf breaks and ancient Hindu temples. The only problem is, you often have to battle traffic to get to them.

title.children: Eat, pray, traffic jam: Bali's heaving roads may become a thing of the past with a $29 billion train line

image.altText: CodySean

props.synopsis: In a season that went to the very last game to decide who made the eight, the AFL finals look wide open for a shock result — but how will it all play out on the field?

title.children: The data that shows why the teams in the bottom half of the eight could push for the AFL flag

image.altText: James Maloney

props.synopsis: Premiership player James Maloney is sacked by the Cowboys on the eve of the finals after being charged with drink driving.

title.children: Cowboys assistant coach Maloney sacked on the eve of finals over drink driving charge

image.altText: Hands hold up a gold, silver and bronze medal

props.synopsis: Keep up with how many medals Aussie athletes won overnight — and where Australia sits on the leaderboard.

title.children: Here are the medal standings after day six of the Paralympic Games

image.altText: Building with sign 'Liverpool City Council'

props.synopsis: A Liverpool City Council building in south-west Sydney has been ruled out as the site of a cancer cluster after a thorough testing process.

title.children: An 'unusual' cancer cluster at a Sydney council building occurred by 'chance'. Why do they happen?

image.altText: A koala facing towards the right of frame sits on a road, the koala fills the whole image and the background is only asphalt.

props.synopsis: We examined approved and proposed projects under federal environment legislation to look at how much koala habitat is being slated for destruction across several industries.

title.children: Thousands of hectares of koala habitat are cleared every year, including for renewable energy projects

image.altText: A plain-clothed policeman leads a man in dark clothing towards a police plane on a remote airstrip.

props.synopsis: Police arrested the two men after allegedly witnessing them unloading 110kg of cocaine at a remote Cape York wharf.

title.children: Pair arrested over alleged attempt to import $44m worth of cocaine from small boat

image.altText: A beluga whale being fed fish from a boat.

props.synopsis: The death of a friendly beluga "spy whale" with a mysterious past shows the complex relationship between humans and wildlife, with conservationists split on how best to protect the animal until the end.

title.children: How a Russian 'spy whale' captured the hearts and minds of conservationists, while splitting them at the same time
